Framing a new house typically estimated at $11 - $22 per square foot for labor and materials. Custom made house framing including building multiple dormers, arches, 2 – 3 levels ceilings or complicated roof designs might increase the price up to 50% - 70% or even more. Estimating labor cost. Standard 2,100 square feet house will cost $9,030 - $17,220 or $4.30 - $8.20 per sq. ft. for labor and crew of five should be able to complete the work and pass framing inspection within 2 – 3 weeks. Contractor typically will estimate garage area at 15 – 20% lower rate than living space.

House Framing Costs. When considering the costs involved with framing a home, you must account for both labor as well as materials. While framing a home or room is a service most general contractors can provide, more complicated framing may require the use of a skilled carpenter.

House Framing Prices. The cost to frame a house is dependent on the cost of materials, primarily lumber, and labor. The cost of lumber has been soaring of late due to a recovering housing market, rising fuel costs, the disruption of lumber supplies, and increased international construction activity. 1 According to the National Association of Home Builders, current lumber prices are just under $350 per 1,000 board feet. 2  The labor costs to frame a home typically run $5 to $10 per square foot. 3  This can fluctuate a bit depending on local labor costs and seasonal rates
